name: Mount Morris House

reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about Mount Morris House - but let me try. Two friends and I met in New York April 26-May 5 for our semi-annual girls' week. Mount Morris House is a beutiful brownstone in a gorgeous area. We had the Terracotta Suite, which looked across the street at Marcus Garvey Park. The woodwork and finishes throughout the house are just spectacular; the chandeliers are extraordinary, and it is magnificently furnished and decorated perfectly for this historic home. Demitri is an excellent host and made us feel right at home. The room was lovely in every way, and we had so much space with the dressing room and large bathroom with rainfall showerhead..
reviews.title: Mount Morris House is Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The neighborhood has everything you would want - a wonderful coffee shop for my caramel latte's just two blocks away. There is a lot of great shopping just three blocks away on 125th Street, as well as a post office for shipping home dirty clothes when your purchases don't fit in your suitcase. There are some wine shops close by, but my favorite was on W 116th, where we found the best wine ever! Lots of nice shops throughout the neighborhood. And not to mention the wonderful selection of restaurants, even Sylvia's, which had food that exceeded expectations.
reviews.title: Old world charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Within a few blocks you will find very easy access to subway lines on both the westside and eastside; on the express lines, you are just a few stops to the Upper West or Upper East sides, or to midtown, and an easy ride to Battery Park or Brooklyn. An easy trip up to the NY Botanical Gardens in the Bronx! Very convenient to bus routes as well as subways - the #1 runs right in front of the house, and the #7 stops just three blocks away, if you prefer the bus to subways.
reviews.title: A treasure in NYC

reviews.text: Great proximity to many parks - What a great location! . As I mentioned, Marcus Garvey Park across the street was new for me, and I loved it. I also walked from the hotel to High Bridge Park, Morningside Park, Central Park, and Riverside Park. Such a quiet and perfect location in every way - . But me, I liked the walking. The last day, I walked from the hotel to Penn Station to catch the train to JFK - it might be a bit far for some, but it was a perfect day for walking, and took less than two hours. Of course, you can always get a cab, that's just not the way I travel.
reviews.title: A different and enjoyable experience in NYC

reviews.text: I highly recommend Mount Morris House - but I am hoping that there will be a room available for our next trip in September! Enjoy!! Chissis from San Diego
reviews.title: Hospitality second-to-none.....

reviews.text: Mount Morris House is one of the few hotels where the real-life appearance of the rooms surpasses the website photos. My room, "Sage", was huge, charmingly decorated, and very comfortable. The bathroom has a huge bathtub and a separate large shower unit. The front lounge is breathtaking, with vintage lamps and shelves full of books.
reviews.title: lovely house, lovely host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is very convenient--lots of good restaurants nearby, walk to Central Park, just a few stops on the subway from all the attractions. And Harlem itself is amazing.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But what made my stay the most memorable was the kindness of Vasili, the owner, who found a room for me when I arrived 1 day earlier than my reservation--I had forgotten that I was going back over the International Date Line. Not many hoteliers would have gone to such lengths to help a guest rectify her own mistake.
reviews.title: may 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't have my photos on this computer, but will be adding some of my own. Can't say enough good things about Mount Morris House.
reviews.title: Our Home in Harlem!

reviews.text: Mount Morris House B&B quiet immaculately clean and private. Not a bad word to say and will definitely be returning when back in New York. Location was convenient and host very pleasant gentleman. We loved staying in the loft!
reviews.title: Home Sweet Home Again in Harlem, and a Home Run.

reviews.text: This is a wonderful, peaceful, gentle place to stay. We first had a six day stay, and after two days in an appalling apartment, we fled back for another nine nights to the comfort of Mount Morris House. The owners took a great deal of trouble to accommodate us, and to make us welcome once more. They are courteous, responsive, generous and helpful exactly when you need help. They are not obtrusive, nor do they interrupt your privacy. Our room was large, comfortable, and kept scrupulously clean by the excellent housekeeper, the linen is high quality, the complimentary toiletries are high quality too, from New Zealand (the "Manuka" line), and although there is no formal breakfast, there is tea and coffee available together with freshly baked cake and other confections available 24 hours a day in the pristine little kitchen. On a couple of nights, we brought food home from Zabar's and Fairway and had a feast sitting up at the small counter table in the kitchen. We made sure that we cleaned up after ourselves properly. The house is meticulously run, and it benefits enormously from this. Guests are asked not to have food in the elegant living room, and not to keep open food in the bedrooms. There is a refrigerator for guests' use in the kitchen. The guests all recognise what a jewel this place is, and respect the house and its gently-expressed rules, accordingly. It is conveniently located, we walked at all hours in complete safety, it is quiet, and a delightful place to return to after a hurly-burly day in a great metropolis. We will always stay here if we can get a booking.
reviews.title: Comfort, kindness, cleanliness, unsurpassed

reviews.text: I found Mount Morris House online and just took a chance that it was all it seemed to be for my first trip to NYC. I was lucky! The house is authentic and charming. My room had all the spacious, comfortable and clean qualities that are hard to find in a big city hotel. It was fun to explore the city and then return to a quiet and welcoming home with warm spice cake waiting in the pantry. Coffee and tea were always available. We were offered help with luggage with Dimitri arranged a car to take us to the airport.......even coming to the door to say goodbye.
reviews.title: Charm and comfort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected Mount Morris house for our first visit to New York because we wanted somewhere spacious and quiet to go home to after a busy day in NY. We were not disappointed , the bedroom and bathroom were very large,clean and comfortable and there was very little noise at night so we slept well. Mount Morris is about 5 mins walk to the subway at 116th street and 3 mins to caffe latte from where you can obtain a good breakfast. The innkeeper Vasili meet us as arranged and was very helpful. I would recommend this accommodation for a visit to NY.
reviews.title: New York experience
A great boutique hotel
reviews.text: We have just spent a very comfortable, relaxing 8 nights at this wonderful boutique hotel. It's described as a bed and breakfast but it no longer serves breakfast. Guests can use the well equipped kitchen which always seemed to be stocked with complimentary chocolates, brownies and cake. Departing guests seem to leave leftover alcohol for enjoyment by other guests.

We stayed in the Jade Suite on the second floor. It lived up to the accurate descriptions on the website. Mount Morris House is an elegant 1890's mansion which has been beautifully restored, maintained and furnished by the owners. The location is very good as it is in a nice part of Harlem. The M1 bus which travels downtown along 5th Avenue stops a few metres from the house. The subway station at 116th street is just a short walk away and the connections to other stations are good. There are plenty of reasonably priced restaurants and cafes nearby. The uptown location makes it very quiet at night and we always slept well. By New York standards, Mount Morris House is a bargain.
reviews.title: Will recommend to all!

reviews.text: Chosen for its trip advisor ratings, Mount Morris House lived up to the excellent reviews. We were in the Sage room on the first floor, beautifully appointed with large double bed and huge marble bathroom. This is one of the cooler, quieter rooms, so a super choice for the high season. The open library on the ground floor is a spectacular room which provided a delightful space one evening whilst sheltering from the storm. European visitors should understand that the Mount Morris is more 'serviced rooms' than bed and breakfast. Breakfast (and other meals) can be taken at one of the local coffee shops or cafés - although fresh coffee, a wide range of tea and biscuits are always available in the galley kitchen. Vasili was a charming and helpful host, discrete but available if needed. Harlem proved to be fascinating. We followed the house suggestions and visited 'Il Cafe Latte' for breakfast, with highlights at the 'Red Rooster' and 'Lenox Lounge'. Internet access was patchy away from the library, and during our stay access to the dining room (shown in the visitors' gallery) was not available for guests. But for anyone wanting a touch of luxury, style and comfort in a fascinating location with a great host, look no further than the Mount Morris House.
reviews.title: Look no further than Mount Morris House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Mount Morris House for 13 nights (our entire stay in New York). The furnishings, beds, cleanliness and our host were great. For the first week we were in a lovely room on the first floor, complete with marble floored bathroom. It was very spacious and beautifully set up. In our second week we were moved up to The Loft, a climb up 3 flights of stairs. This room was huge, and has a well equipped kitchen. However it was a little hotter and noisier. It would be great for a family. The coffee and biscotti in the kitchen were lovely. The subway was a short walk away and the bus nearly outside the door. It was fascinating to stay in Harlem and soak up a bit of the atmosphere.
reviews.title: Lovely place to stay in Harlem

reviews.text: I couldn't believe my eyes when we arrived at the Mount Morris House. This exquisite brownstone is beautifully decorated, clean and artful. We felt taken care of. The host was unobtrusive but extremely helpful. The loft is an extraordinary space for New York, huge, beautiful with lovely art and a spacious feel. We got to know the neighborhood which is quite nice with a great coffee shop around the corner.
reviews.title: A sophisticated slice of heaven

reviews.text: We enjoyed very much staying in Mount Morris House. It was a very comfortable, quiet, and peaceful place to return after our exhausting explorations of the City. Combined with the great hospitality of the hosts and the high quality and spaciousness of our suite, we felt that we got a great value for our money too. If you are a history fan and want to know more on New York history and architecture, don't hesitate to ask the host. He is a history professor and a fountain of information on old and new New York!
reviews.title: Hidden treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Mount Morris for 9 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the property and its location. Met on arrival by very pleasant host Vasili and shown to a capacious street-facing bedroom with a large dressing room and excellent bathroom. The lovely brownstone building is in a quiet location but is just around the corner from the heart of Harlem with its vibrant shopping centre, including some interesting cafes and restaurants. The subway was a short walk from the house and we enjoyed travelling into the city everyday but were always pleased to return to our pleasant retreat at night. Would definitely recommend this property as a great alternative to the 'impersonal' hotel-type accommodation.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

aka: Mount Morris House Hotel New York City
description: Treat yourself to spacious, quiet, luxurious b&b style accommodations in a splendid Manhattan townhouse. We invite you to stay in our large bedroom suites and make yourself at home in this historic New York residence. Minutes away from Downtown Manhattan, you can experience the hustle and bustle of the City and have a peaceful and quiet place to rest in the evening.All rooms have en-suite bathrooms, pillow-top beds, plasma HDTV television, radio and alarm clocks, WiFi, hair dryers, iron and iron-board and maid service. Quiet and sunny, with great vistas of Mount Morris Park and resident proprietors who are always ready to share their knowledge of New York life, Mount Morris House offers its guests an unforgettable experience of luxurious b&b style accommodation and personal care in the heart of New York at reasonable cost. Now offering our economy comfort private bedrooms with shared bathroom.
